TaskDescription: A multiple-object localizer (including both cropped and naturalistic faces, human bodies, human limbs, houses, places, cars, guitars, words, and numbers) was performed 8 times (twice each across four sessions; (Troiani et al., 2014)). Each stimulus class was presented in 4-second mini-blocks with items presented at 2 Hz (8 items per mini-block). In each run, 12 mini-blocks of each class were presented along 12 interspersed 4-second fixation blocks (acquisition time: 5:13). Half of the blocks included a single phase-scrambled image; the subject’s task was to press a button whenever a phase-scrambled item appeared.
